messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: [A-Za-z ]+ '

Imagine a group of thirteen scholars. From Vicky you have two choices, Amir and Wim.  Amir is connected to Raj, and Raj is connected to Wei. Wei is connected to Reza and Reza is connected to Ian. Ian is connected to Puja. Puja is donating 10 books, but you do not take any book, you're just learning about the environment. This time you ask Vicky to connect you to Wim who is connected to Jing. Jing is connected to Nisha. Nisha is connected to Kim and Kim is connected to Moin. Moin is connected to Sara. Sara has 50 books to donate, but you do not take any money, you're just learning about the environment. You return to Vicky. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the maximum number of books.  Starting from Vicky, which path will lead to the maximum number of books?  Please list all scholar names in order, separated by commas

Yes, I understand I can only choose one path that leads to the maximum number, from Vicky we have the paths:
With Amir I get Reze and Ian: (Amir => Reze) -> (Reze => Ian) => None
Connected path: Amir-Reze Ian. Which doesn't lead anybook to max. This Path lead one connection to another connection in max path. Ignoring first option
With wim you have one option, and he get Nish from him the Nish lead one connection Kim connected. With the Nish connected with:
With Nish I have Moin connected and Kim Connected; therefore, we go with this option. Path selection; with Nish <= Kim <= Moin => (Nish >=Moin) which max no connections as no more step ahead. Path Max selection ends here. Nish connected -> Kim connection no path can exceed as it has one-step lead and no next-step further paths can form which lead me on Moins as max selection. Finally, I choose path with starting condition Vicky connecting Amir. This path selection results in choosing option to have Nishi-Moin Connection without extending Path furthermore to its endpoint as it's maximization ends. Thus our Max result is reached via exploring one Connection from connecting (Wim) then with connection to connecting path. Which is (Vicky) Amir connected ending at (Vicky =>Amir path selection ending). This max option of ( (Wim)->>Max option at Wlm)) => ((wm -> connecting Amir) option => (Moinf))), the result path max selection we can find to connect wam (((Vick-WimPath selection, ending)) resulting) into books will result from NishiMo in books connected without another Path ahead after a complete loop

Path with end: Max Nish Moin Selection end. Therefore Max answer is ((Wimm)).

You are told that Ian has a new connection Pam, who has an instant connection portal. From this portal it is possible to connect with any of Moinâ€™s connection. When you return to Vicky and choose the path that leads to the maximum number of books, you discover that the regular path to the scholar with the maximum number of books is blocked. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the maximum number of books. Starting from Vicky, which path will lead to the maximum number of books?  Please list all scholar names in order, separated by commas.

Yes,I understand given blocks by regular portal at Vicky can only be used 
Wit path selection Vick-Wim at Wim we already had path connecting Nish to End resulting  path which blocks regular portal to Max no of ending books found on portal as Pam cannot block that one portal which lead Moins maximum Books as Pam cant do that; so, max Path will Connect one of Moin instant Connect.  There are three instant paths open at MoIN, Pam connect instantly but portal is not included path as max path which needs to choose the end path with books. So it leads to path of connection Pam to RIJAY Connect option from Pam is  Connectivity end => (connect RiJAY to max no books connection => RiHAAN <= RiKAI). The End result Max Connect will be with RiAhAh  Max number of scholarship, since maximum ending Path.
Path for Connect scholar => ( RIA JlA, RAziJ.AM), where RiAhAh Connect lead to Path to Max => ( Pam Rija => Connect MoNi Path) Connection selection  result Ri Ha An as Connection Max Option result books will be on books list result end, there won't be any new max options left at Pam and end path with RiOhhh the result as Max No with no connections is to Path option, or Portal or books connection path as Path portal block is Max => (( Answer-> Connect (( Wimm Path to Path Connect Select IAN)))
(( End Option Ria Jl.AM Connection Ria J  to RIHa Option)))

expected_answer: Answer: Amir, Raj, Wei, Reza, Ian, Pam, Sara

The End result Max Connect will be with RiAhAh  Max number of scholarship, since maximum ending Path.
